name: Drury Plaza Hotel at the Arch

reviews.text: This hotel was very nice and clean. When we checked in, the lobby was very beautiful and clean. We had a room on the fifth floor and had a great parking spot in the parking garage on the second floor. The parking garage elevators go directly to the room floors. There are no tunnels or corridors, just a simple elevator stop! We went into the two adjoining rooms on the fifth floor. There were in-door "gardens" on a few of the floors. The rooms were very beautiful and had large bathrooms and beds. The beds were the most comfortable of the four hotels we have stayed in during our vacation. Each television had the ability to buy movies and connect video game consoles to them. The lobby had a fountain and a huge chandelier. Another fountain was surrounded in brass or copper sculptures depicting the Lewis and Clark expedition. The hotel had two restaurants attached to it. One was a moderate bar and grill. The other was a more expensive steak house. The ONLY complaints I were the fact that you must use a key card to call an elevator on the first floor and the pool. The small pool that was on the eighth floor was very murky and green. You could not see the bottom of the pool at the three foot mark. I suggest that this hotel is very great for business men/women, travelers, and families, as long as you don't want to swim! The breakfast buffet was great. The free 1 hour long distance, unlimited local calling and free internet were truly appreciated. Highly recommend this place, and suspect the pool murkiness will be remedied soon. The hotel seems to go the extra mile….
reviews.title: This was a very nice hotel.

likes.liked: — Great atmosphere from the entrance to through the rooms. Great location!
likes.disliked: — Pool looked like it was in some chemical troubles and was murky green.

reviews.text: The Drury is a beautiful hotel with a pleasant staff and lots of amenities. It couldn't be in a better location downtown. Our only complaint is that it was full of ladies attending a convention, and they all came for the complimentary breakfast at the same time. The lines were so long that we were forced to leave without eating, since
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we had a schedule to keep. Hopefully this was a rare occurence.
reviews.title: Very Good

reviews.text: Otherwise the hotel is great!
reviews.title: Great hotel for families

likes.liked: — Great rates, friendly staff, view of river
likes.disliked: — there was nothing that I disliked

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Two of us stayed one night in mid-June 2007. It was our first trip to St Louis in many, many years, and the first stay downtown. It was a nice and clean king-size bed room with a very fancy marble bath. The water closet was separate from the sink/mirror and the closet was adequate. We paid just a little more for a Gateway Arch view room (540), and it was magnificent - especially at night. Facing the Arch is a bit noisy with traffic most of the night, as it faces an interstate corridor, at least down on the 5th floor where we were, so if you're a light sleeper ...(?), but we we slept fine. The afternoon complimentary snacks/refreshments and breakfast were a big plus, too...not gourmet, but adequate. Parking was $10/day and you are supposed to be out of the parking garage at check-out time. However, we were still sight-seeing until late afternoon and they said we could stay parked in the garage until we left (the front desk had to "buzz us through" to the elevator when we were finally ready to leave town). This is arguably the closest hotel to the Gateway Arch (Adams Mark and Millennium Hotel are nearby, too). Of course, it's location, location, location. This hotel is very near Busch Stadium (going to a foot/base ball game or just to tour) and the Gateway Arch/riverfront (and other downtown attractions/museums). The hotel is so close to all of these, that you couldn't drive there quicker than you could walk. We would definitely stay here again to be near the downtown St Louis attractions. A very good value.
reviews.title: Great City Hotel

reviews.text: I'm a little late in writing this well deserved excellent review. The Drury Plaza amazed me at every turn with the amount of amenities that are included in the price of the room. Free HSIA, free breakfast (big buffet with lots of choices) free popcorn and sodas virtually all day, two free drinks at the bar every night, free local calls, and hour of free long distance, the list went on and on. I really couldn't believe it.
reviews.title: Unmatched Service Level

likes.liked: — All of the amenities included for free, the location adjacent to the Arch, unbelievable staff
likes.disliked: — Parking garage was a little tight

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had all that, a partial view of the Gateway Arch, a spotless room, wonderful attentive staff, and we paid $79 a night (even though we stayed during the St. Louis Cardinals playoffs).
reviews.title: Darn Near Perfect......

likes.liked: — The Hot Breakfast in the morning and Cocktail hour in the evening.

reviews.text: Although I may not have an occaision to return to St. Louis anytime soon, there's no doubt I'd stay at the Drury Plaza.
reviews.title: A Trifecta: Location, Service, Price

reviews.text: Oh, and if you have kids, take them to the City Museum. It is a wonderful place, just a couple of miles from the Drury.
reviews.title: No regrets staying at the Drury Plaza

reviews.text: Stayed at the Drury Plaza Downtown St. Louis for the weekend to see my Kansas City Chiefs play the St. Louis Rams (Chiefs won - yahoo!!!). Anyway......my family already loves Drury Inns, but the ones we have been to have all been kind of run down and old. We keep coming back to Drury because of their great hot breakfast and their cocktail hour in the evenings with free snacks. This Drury Plaza was more than a pleasant surprise. The inside lobby is huge and quite nice for a Drury. The late afternoon we checked in, the lobby was active with Chiefs fans and the staff who had to look after all of the Kansas City visitors seemed quite in control. The front desk was efficient and trained well. The cocktail hour was already going on and the whole lobby just oozed of spirit and fun! Our room was more than adequate. No complaints there. The parking situation is the only downfall, but most all of the downtown hotels have the same problem. Parking was FREE and at least the Drury allowed us to keep our car parked in their lots while we were at the game. We were only about 6 or 7 blocks from Edward Jones Dome...and easy walk. There is a Drury right next door to the stadium, but they had been booked for weeks because of this rival game. All in all.......a GREAT stay at the Drury Plaza St. Louis.
reviews.title: Another GREAT stay at the Plaza

likes.liked: — The free drinks and breakfast, hospitality of the staff, location.

reviews.text: I went to St. Louis to attend a professional convention. Upon arrival at the Drury Plaza, I was greeted enthusiastically. The staff were able to make suggestions on meeting some needs that they were unable to provide. My room was clean, the staff were very upbeat, and the breakfast was wonderful! I appreciated the free 60 minutes of long distance so that I could call home and check on a few loose ends. The arch is a short walk away, as was the stadium. The America Center was a longer walk, but still doable by this middle-aged body. My colleagues wished they had made reservations at the Drury Plaza, as the hotel they selected didn't measure up the same way. The only downside is that the hotel restaurant, Carmine's, is rather pricey.
reviews.title: Excellent Stay at Drury Plaza, St. Louis!

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Drury Plaza Hotel the night before a conference I had to attend. The hotel was very nicely decorated and rooms seemed to have been recently redone. The room was a bit on the small side but adequate for 2 people. The bed was very comfortable but the pillows a bit too poufy for me, and they were all the same (some hotels offer a variety). The room seemed to be very clean, and had a refrigerator and microwave hidden behind cabinetry. The Quikstart breakfast was a wonderful array of items. They had a large dining area which was not too crowded when I ate at 8 AM on a Saturday, but when my husband went later he had difficulty finding a seat. Parking was in the building and accessible only by keycard, which was nice (but maneuver carefully if you have a large vehicle; it's cramped). The staff were extremely friendly and cheerfully accomodated our request for a late checkout. I will definitely be staying here again.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed on a slower Thursday night. Very easy to find using the map showing one way streets. We asked if an Arch view room was available and ended up with a corner room that had the best view in the house! We were impressed with every staff member...from the young woman who checked us in to the delightful lady who served me pancakes hot off the grill. We've stayed at the Adams Mark for more money and definitely will stay at the Drury Plaza next time.
reviews.title: Great experience!

likes.liked: — Location across the street from the Arch.

reviews.text: We are repeat cusotmers of the Drury Plaza, we attend a confernce in St Louis every year. We have never had any problems or complaints. It has always been very clean, this coming from someone that carries cleaning supplies with her everywhere she goes. The staff has always been proffesional and helpful. Love the buffet breakfast, yes it does get crowed but it clears out pretty fast, I suspect that they have people coming from other hotels because it good and they have plenty to choose from. Yes the linen could be of better quality, but who cares, it's clean; we are not discussing a four star hotel. Who cares about what the free popcorn and drinks taste like; free is free if you don't like it you don't have to eat or drink, the breakfast more than makes up for it. My only wish is that they would offer more of a variety in their food pantry.
reviews.title: LOVE THE DRURY PLAZA

reviews.text: Stayed here for Cardinals Winter Warm Up. The Room was very comfortable. The bed slept wonderfully. It had free high speed internet. Although like most hotels, my pet peeve, the desk is facing away from the television.
reviews.title: Not Bad

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This place is conveniently located to the ballpark, downtown restaurants and the arch. The plaquard outside boasts that this was a fur trading center with wonderful windows to let in the light.
reviews.title: Rip off, poorly designed hotel

likes.liked: — No windows in some rooms, poor parking facilities, way too expensive

reviews.text: Problems are:
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel, Great Location!

reviews.text: It's very hard to get to due to the one-way streets. Parking is a nightmare - it's inadequate and we had to park in another structure 1 1/2 blocks away. The parking garage in the hotel leaks exhaust fumes into the upper level rooms.
reviews.title: Had a great time!

likes.liked: — Drury Hotels are always great - the free snacks and softdrinks / cocktails are nice.

reviews.title: Five Star Fun on a Shoestring Budget
reviews.text: The worst, however, for our $139/night room, was a window that looks out into the hall! Couple that with screaming kids playing tag, a completely confused "complementary" beverage service, a dirty area - not bussed - for breakast services, aand swampy, tiny pool/hot tub area, it was not a good experience.
For$20 more we could have stayed next door at the Adam's mark with views of the river!
reviews.title: This is the best?

description: When we say “by the arch”, we mean it. This hotel is around the corner from the arch and only a few blocks from Busch Stadium, the Washington Avenue loft district and more. Drury Plaza Hotel offers its guests a variety of free extras – take, for example, our free hot breakfast. At Drury, “hot” means scrambled eggs, biscuits & gravy, sausage and make-your-own Belgian waffles. In the evening, join us at our 5:30 Kickback® for free hot food and cold beverages. Our rotating menu features a variety of hot foods, baked potatoes, garden salad, beer, wine, mixed drinks and more! To burn off all of those free extras, Drury has a 24-hour exercise center and a parking lot to jog around. Lastly, Drury’s free wireless Internet and free long distance calls will ensure you can keep tabs on all of your posse back home.
